New Records: Nikola Jokic recorded his league-leading 15th triple-double of the season and the 145th of his career.
Russell Westbrook holds the NBA record with 202 triple-doubles, with three of them coming this season.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic had 35 points, 15 assists, and 12 rebounds.
Russell Westbrook added 25 points, 11 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Michael Porter Jr. scored 17 points.
Julian Strawther contributed 12 points.
Christian Braun added 11 points.
Peyton Watson had 10 points.
Nuggets guard Jamal Murray didn’t play in the second half due to left knee soreness.
Keon Johnson scored 22 points for the Nets.
Tyrese Martin had 19 points for the Nets.
Noah Clowney scored 14 points for the Nets.
Tosan Evbuomwan, Ben Simmons, Nic Claxton, and Ziaire Williams each had 10 points for the Nets.
Simmons returned to the Brooklyn lineup after missing four games due to calf and back soreness.
The Nuggets led by six at halftime and built on that throughout the third quarter.
Jokic scored Denver’s first five points of the second half.
The lead grew to 94-73 late in the third period, but the Nets mounted a comeback in the fourth.
Evbuomwan scored eight points in the first 2:27 of the final period to spark a 13-3 run.
The lead was 101-95 after Johnson drained a 3-pointer, but the Nuggets started to pull away again.
Westbrook made four free throws, Braun sank two from the line, and Braun hit a running dunk in a 16-5 run that made it 117-100, and Denver closed it out.
Brooklyn led by as many as eight points in the first quarter, but the Nuggets used a 16-2 run in the second quarter to lead 56-48.
Johnson hit a layup just before the end of the period to get the Nets within 65-59 at halftime.
